sense.def:
To poke someone or something
pomeni na hitro potisniti prst ali oster predmet v nekoga ali nekaj.

seg.quote: People poked the students with their umbrellas.
Ralph began to poke little holes in the sand.
Len gave him an affectionate poke.

sense.def:
To poke one thing into another
pomeni potisniti neko stvar v drugo.

seg.quote: Never poke scissors into an electric socket.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
pokes out of or through another thing
, se pokaže izza ali izpod nečesa.

seg.quote: ...cotton wool poking out of his ear.
Blades of grass poked up between the paving stones.

sense.def:
To poke one's head through an opening
pomeni potisniti glavo skozi odprtino, pogosto zato, da bi nekaj laže videli.

seg.quote: The driver slowed down and poked his head out of the window.

sense.def:
To poke about
ali
to poke around for something
pomeni nekaj iskati, največkrat tako, da premaknemo veliko predmetov;

seg.quote: He was lying flat on his stomach, poking around under the bed with his arm.

sense.def:
To poke at something
pomeni dotikati se nečesa z vrsto hitrih drobnih premikov koničastega predmeta.

seg.quote: The chef poked at his little pile of ashes.
